name: Shroud Ray
description: The Shroud Ray has a gelatinous body that mimics the appearance of sand when motionless, blending seamlessly into its aquatic environment.
memorable: It can blind and suffocate its prey by grappling them, while using fear tactics to control the battlefield.
goals: To ambush unsuspecting foes and dominate aquatic environments.
environment: Underwater, often in environments that allow for camouflage and stealth.
strengths: Exceptional grappling ability and stealth, resistant to bludgeoning damage.
weaknesses: Sensitive to bright light, facing disadvantages in such conditions.
attacks: Employs bite and tail attacks, with the bite allowing it to grapple and the tail inflicting poison.
most_powerful_ability: Can instill fear in nearby creatures with a moan, controlling the battlefield while also creating illusions of itself for defense.
senses: Has the ability to create a false appearance, making it undetectable when still.
skills: Possesses a high stealth skill bonus, making it effective at sneaking upon and ambushing its targets.
additional_information: Can only hold one creature grappled at a time.
Utilizes flickering illusions to gain advantage in combat.
Immune to being charmed or frightened.
Its moan ability can create temporary fear, forcing enemies to retreat.
Can damage both itself and the grappled target when engaged.
test_queries: monster that pretends to be sand
creature that blinds and suffocates its prey
Shroud Ray fear tactics and camouflage
